Footer.sustainabilityIntro: SyriaHub is a non-profit research commons. When contributions are accepted, they are used exclusively to sustain the shared infrastructure that enables long-term access, research integrity, and platform reliability.
Footer.sustainabilityDataInfrastructureDesc: Databases, backups, spatial indexing, and long-term data preservation.
Footer.sustainabilityDeploymentDesc: Hosting, monitoring, security hardening, and operational resilience.
Footer.sustainabilityMaintenanceDesc: Bug fixes, dependency updates, documentation, and technical debt reduction.
Footer.sustainabilityGovernanceDesc: Review workflows, provenance tracking, audit logs, and trust safeguards.
Footer.sustainabilityAIDesc: Retrieval, analysis, moderation support, and research assistance. AI systems are constrained, non-extractive, and do not monetise user data.
Footer.sustainabilityStatement: SyriaHub does not sell data, prioritise engagement metrics, or place knowledge behind paywalls. All funding decisions are guided by the principle of preserving the platform as a public research commons.
Footer.sustainabilityContact: For institutions or individuals interested in supporting this infrastructure, further details are available upon request.

content.missionIntro: SyriaHub was created to democratize research collaboration, making knowledge accessible and collaborative for everyone.
content.missionVision: We envision a world where knowledge flows freely, where researchers from all backgrounds can contribute, learn, and collaborate without barriers.
content.missionValues: Our core values: Integrity, Collaboration, Accessibility, and Excellence.
content.ethicsIntro: We are committed to maintaining the highest ethical standards in research and community interaction.
content.ethicsResearch: All research shared on our platform must adhere to principles of academic integrity, proper attribution, and ethical conduct.
content.ethicsCommunity: We expect all community members to engage respectfully, constructively, and in good faith.
content.methodologyIntro: Our platform employs rigorous quality assurance measures to maintain content integrity.
content.methodologyModeration: Content is reviewed by our moderation team and community to ensure accuracy and adherence to our guidelines.
content.methodologyPeer: Our peer review system allows the community to evaluate and endorse high-quality contributions.

institutionalContext.title: Institutional Context
institutionalContext.line1: SyriaHub is an independent research platform developed and stewarded within the PluraGate network.
institutionalContext.line2: PluraGate provides organisational, technical, and governance support to multiple public-interest initiatives. Each project within the network operates with its own scope, editorial autonomy, and research mandate.
institutionalContext.line3: SyriaHub retains full independence over its content, methodologies, and moderation practices.

whatIsSyriaHub.a: SyriaHub is a collaborative research platform designed for sharing knowledge, conducting research, and connecting with scholars worldwide. We provide tools for writing, peer review, and community engagement.

howToJoin.a: SyriaHub operates on an invitation system. You need an invitation code from an existing member to create an account. This helps us maintain a quality community of genuine researchers.

whatCanIPost.q: What can I post on SyriaHub?
whatCanIPost.a: You can share research articles, ask questions, answer community questions, share resources like datasets and tools, and create events. All content should contribute to knowledge sharing.

howModeration.a: New posts go through a review process. Our moderators check for quality, accuracy, and adherence to community guidelines. The community can also flag content that violates our policies.

canIEdit.q: Can I edit my posts after publishing?
canIEdit.a: Yes, you can edit your posts at any time. All edits are tracked in version history, maintaining transparency and accountability.

whatAreRoles.q: What are the different user roles?
whatAreRoles.a: We have four roles: Members can participate in discussions, Researchers can publish content, Moderators help maintain community standards, and Administrators manage the platform.

howToBecome.q: How do I become a Researcher?
howToBecome.a: Members can apply for Researcher status. Your application will be reviewed based on your contributions, expertise, and adherence to community guidelines.

isContentFree.q: Is the content on SyriaHub free to access?
isContentFree.a: Yes, all published content is freely accessible. Authors retain their rights and can choose appropriate licenses for their work.

Governance.title: Governance & Trust
Governance.subtitle: How SyriaHub maintains quality without compromising autonomy.

moderation.title: How Moderation Works
moderation.intro: Content moderation follows a layered approach designed to catch problems early while preserving human judgment for complex cases.
moderation.layer1Desc: All content passes through automated checks for harassment, spam, and plagiarism. Flagged content is held for human review.
moderation.layer2Desc: Any user can report content that may violate standards. Reports require explanation and cannot target your own content.
moderation.layer3Desc: Moderators review flagged content and reports. They can approve, request revisions, or reject with explanation.
moderation.layer4Desc: Complex or contested cases go to multiple moderators who review independently and vote.

ai.title: How AI Is Constrained
ai.intro: SyriaHub uses AI for specific, limited purposes with clear constraints:
ai.principle1Desc: Users always know when AI is involved
ai.principle2Desc: All AI decisions can be overridden by humans
ai.principle3Desc: AI does not build user behavioral models
ai.principle4Desc: AI never speaks with false certainty

limits.title: Limits of Authority
limits.intro: Power is safer when its limits are written down.
limits.mod2: Reject content for disagreeing with conclusions
limits.admin2: Who counts as a real researcher
limits.admin3: Exceptions to moderation rules for specific users

sustainability.title: Funding Transparency & Allocation
sustainability.intro: SyriaHub treats financial contributions as infrastructure support, not as a signal for growth or expansion.
sustainability.ledgerIntroPart1: To ensure accountability and trust, the platform maintains a
sustainability.ledgerIntroPart2: as part of its governance framework. This ledger provides a high-level overview of how contributions are used to sustain and improve the research commons.
sustainability.operationalIntro: Contributions are prioritised toward the following operational categories:
sustainability.coreInfrastructureDesc: Hosting, databases, backups, spatial indexing, and system reliability.
sustainability.maintenanceSecurityDesc: Dependency updates, bug fixes, security reviews, and operational continuity.
sustainability.governanceModerationDesc: Review workflows, auditability, provenance tracking, and trust safeguards.
sustainability.aiToolingDesc: Retrieval, analysis, and moderation support systems. AI usage is constrained, non-extractive, and does not monetise user data.
sustainability.surplusIntroPart1: When operational needs are met, surplus funds may be allocated to
sustainability.surplusExample3: Targeted micro-grants for bounded research tasks
sustainability.surplusExample4: Archival recovery or data curation efforts
sustainability.transparencyPrinciple1: No donor influence over content, moderation, or research direction
sustainability.ledgerNote: The Funding Allocation Ledger is updated periodically (e.g. quarterly) and presented for transparency, not real-time tracking or fundraising performance.
sustainability.governanceClosing: This governance framework evolves through documented revisions, not ad-hoc decisions.

futureSustainability.title: Future Sustainability Measures
futureSustainability.intro: To support long-term maintenance, SyriaHub may introduce optional paid features in future versions.
futureSustainability.principle1: Clearly separated from core research functionality
futureSustainability.principle2: Non-essential to reading, publishing, or citing content
futureSustainability.principle3: Designed to support infrastructure, not restrict access
futureSustainability.coreStatement: Core research features will remain accessible and unaffected.
futureSustainability.credibilityNote: Paid features, if introduced, will not influence visibility, moderation outcomes, or research credibility.

stewardship.title: Stewardship & Legal Context
stewardship.intro: SyriaHub is currently stewarded by its founding developer.
stewardship.operationalFundsPart2: as a fiscal host for infrastructure and maintenance purposes. Governance rules, funding boundaries, and allocation policies are enforced at the platform level.
stewardship.ledgerNotePart1: Funding Allocation Ledgers are published periodically via
stewardship.jurisdictionPart2: . A dedicated legal entity may be established as the platform matures.

roleSeparation.title: Role Separation
roleSeparation.intro: The platform’s founding developer acts solely in a technical maintenance capacity.
roleSeparation.noAuthority: This role does not confer authority over:
roleSeparation.independence: Governance rules, moderation workflows, and research processes operate independently of platform maintenance. The system is designed to remain operational and policy-constrained regardless of individual involvement.
roleSeparation.technicalAccess: Technical access does not imply governance authority.

HowItWorks.title: How SyriaHub Works
HowItWorks.subtitle: Understanding the system you're contributing to.

mentalModel.line1: SyriaHub is closer to a shared research notebook than a forum.
mentalModel.line2: Contributions are expected to remain useful even when disagreed with.

contentTypes.title: Content Types
contentTypes.articleDesc: Long-form research with citations, analysis, and conclusions.
contentTypes.articleBestFor: Original research, literature reviews, policy analysis
contentTypes.question: Question
contentTypes.questionDesc: Community Q&A with voting and accepted answers.
contentTypes.questionBestFor: Factual queries, seeking sources, methodological advice
contentTypes.traceDesc: Collective memory artefacts—primary sources preserved for the record.

forking.title: Forking & Attribution
forking.intro: Content can be forked—creating a new version that builds on the original while maintaining attribution.
forking.step1: Click Fork on any post to create a new draft with the original content
forking.step2: Edit and extend as needed to take the work in a new direction
forking.step3: On publish, your fork links back to the original and appears in its Forks section

citations.title: Citations & Versioning
citations.intro: The citation system tracks how knowledge connects across the platform.
citations.editWindowDesc: After publishing, you have 24 hours to make corrections. After that, edits create new versions.
citations.backlinksDesc: When you cite another post, a backlink appears on the original showing how work is connected.

spatial.title: Spatial Context & Awareness
spatial.intro: Posts can specify geographic regions and time periods they cover, enabling spatial pattern detection.
spatial.flagsDesc: Awareness flags are suggestions, not conclusions. They are dismissible, session-only, and never stored as metadata.

gaps.title: Research Gaps Lifecycle
gaps.intro: Research gaps map what we don't know, helping coordinate effort and avoid duplication.
